Analysis: Analyze the distribution of Wins (W) to understand the typical performance of teams over the years.
Explore the correlation between Runs Scored (RS) and Runs Allowed (RA) with Wins (W) to identify key performance indicators.
Examine the trend of On-Base Percentage (OBP) and Slugging Percentage (SLG) over the years to see if there are changes in team strategies.
Identify outliers in the data, particularly in the Playoffs column, to understand what factors contribute to exceptional team performances.
Perform a time series analysis on key metrics like Wins (W) and Runs Scored (RS) to detect any long-term trends or patterns.
Handle missing values in the dataset by either imputing them with appropriate statistical measures or removing the affected rows/columns.
Normalize the numeric features to bring all variables to a similar scale, which can improve model performance.
Encode categorical variables such as Team and League using techniques like one-hot encoding or label encoding.
Remove redundant features if any are identified during the correlation analysis phase.
Check for and remove duplicate entries to ensure data integrity.
Create a new feature representing the difference between Runs Scored (RS) and Runs Allowed (RA) to quantify a team's offensive and defensive efficiency.
Calculate the ratio of Wins (W) to Games Played (G) to create a win percentage feature, which can be a more meaningful metric than raw wins.
Aggregate statistics by team and year to create features that capture a team's historical performance.
Use polynomial features for metrics like OBP and SLG to capture potential nonlinear relationships with the target variable.
Engineer features that capture the interaction between offensive and defensive metrics, such as the product of OBP and SLG.
Train multiple models (e.g., Linear Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting) and compare their performance to select the best one.
Use cross-validation techniques to ensure that the model's performance is consistent across different subsets of the data.
Implement regularization techniques like L1 or L2 regularization to prevent overfitting, especially for linear models.
Incorporate feature selection methods to identify the most relevant features for the model, which can simplify the model and improve interpretability.
Optimize model hyperparameters using grid search or random search to achieve the best possible performance.
